exam.question: His career was not noticeably ______ by the fact that he had never been to college.

answer.explain: 句意： 他从没上过大学这一事实并没有明显地妨碍到他的事业。 prevent： 阻止， 预防， 常与from连用； restrain： 抑制， 阻止； refrain： 节制， 避免； 制止。

sentences.sContent: His career has been hindered by injury.
sentences.sCn: 由于受伤，他的事业受到了阻碍。

sentences.sContent: policies that will hinder rather than help families
sentences.sCn: 对家庭有害无益的政策

sentences.sContent: ...Broad-based welfare-state policies hinder women's representation in elite competitive positions...

remMethod.val: hind(后面的) ＋ er → 使落在后面 → 阻碍， 妨碍

words.tran: 最后面的，最靠近后方的

trans.tranOther: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed
